other_tests.findings: There is bibasilar atelectasis, left greater than right. No pleural or pericardial effusion. The gallbladder is distended with biliary sludge and fragmented stones. The gallbladder wall appears edematous and thickened. There is trace pericholecystic fluid. A stone is seen near the gallbladder neck. No intra or extrahepatic ductal dilatation. The liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenals, kidneys, ureters, bladder, and appendix are normal. No bowel obstruction or bowel wall thickening is seen. No free fluid or free air in the abdomen or pelvis. No mesenteric, retroperitoneal, pelvic sidewall, or inguinal lymphadenopathy. No focal bony lesion suspicious for malignancy present.
